messages.subject: Coriolis Effect- myth about drains
messages.msgSnippet: It is widely believed that the Coriolis Efect causes water to swirl one direction in the Northern hemisphere and the other direction in the Southern
messages.messageBody:
It is widely believed that the Coriolis Efect causes water to swirl
one direction in the Northern hemisphere and the other direction in
the Southern hemisphere...
Actually, this is only a myth as the Coriolis Efect works on a much
larger scale.

Here is a page I found about why water "swirls" as it goes down the
drain and why it swirls in one direction vs. the other.

http://www.snopes.com/science/coriolis.htm

Kiersten

P.S. I am not relying on this website as my only source of info.
(We learned about this in Physics)

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] What is this called?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/7/2005 4:22:25 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... When we were little, me and my sister called it a tornado cause that s  what it looked like.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/7/2005 4:22:25 PM Eastern Standard Time,
momasarg@... writes:

>The term we use is vortex.<



When we were little, me and my sister called it a tornado cause that's what
it looked like.

Nancy B.

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] What is this called?
messages.msgSnippet: Coriolis Effect? Elizabeth, NYC ayala_s  wrote: What do you call it when the water in the bathtub is almost drained out and it starts to
messages.messageBody:
Coriolis Effect?

Elizabeth, NYC

ayala_s <ayala_s@...> wrote:
What do you call it when the water in the bathtub is almost drained out and
it starts to look like a funnel? My husband called it a whirlpool but I
think there is a more specific name for it than that.



My son is fascinated by this phenomenon.



Ayala

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] What is this called?
messages.msgSnippet: ... There s a theater in Albuquerque called The Vortex, so nobody will look in the tub and say Vortex here; not very likely.  All those words, swirl and
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/7/05 1:09:13 PM, danielle.conger@... writes:


> Vortex?
>

There's a theater in Albuquerque called The Vortex, so nobody will look in
the tub and say "Vortex" here; not very likely. <g>

All those words, swirl and vortex and whirlpool, have bigger meanings.
English is so full of words...

Sandra

messages.messageBody:
What do you call it when the water in the bathtub is almost drained out and
it starts to look like a funnel? My husband called it a whirlpool but I

My son is fascinated by this phenomenon.
